channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The problem won't be fixed in 1.8.* (font processing was rewritten in 2.0 because there were too many problems), but I see that the font rendering is even worse in 2.0 for some reason.

I get an acceptable rendering on Mac OS X. Acrobat performs slightly better font substitution as it's using a modern style font whereas PDFBox is using a traditional script font.

What platform(s) has this bug been reported on? (Other than Windows 8, of course).

Given that the glyphs being drawn are clearly the wrong ones, I'm wondering if there's a specific TTF "cmap" table format present in certain Windows fonts which we're handling incorrectly.

I get these warnings in 2.0 ("No Unicode mapping" warnings not included) on Windows 7:

WARNUNG: Using fallback font ArialUnicodeMS for CID-keyed TrueType font FZLTXIHK_SBJT--GBK1-0
WARNUNG: Using fallback font ArialUnicodeMS for CID-keyed TrueType font FZLTHK_SBJT--GBK1-0
WARNUNG: Using fallback font ArialUnicodeMS for CID-keyed TrueType font FZHTK--GBK1-0
WARNUNG: Using fallback font ArialUnicodeMS for CID-keyed TrueType font FZLTDHK_SBJT--GBK1-0
WARNUNG: Using fallback font ArialUnicodeMS for CID-keyed TrueType font FZDHTK--GBK1-0
WARNUNG: Using fallback font ArialUnicodeMS for CID-keyed TrueType font FZLTTHK_SBJT--GBK1-0
WARNUNG: Using fallback font ArialUnicodeMS for CID-keyed TrueType font FZLTZHK_SBJT--GBK1-0
WARNUNG: Using fallback font ArialUnicodeMS for CID-keyed TrueType font FZTYSK_SBJT--GBK1-0
WARNUNG: Using fallback font ArialUnicodeMS for CID-keyed TrueType font FZBYSK_SBJT--GBK1-0
ArialUnicodeMS does contain a full compliment of Asian glyphs, so it should work as a substitute. Given that we know it works with other fonts, something must be going wrong at the TTF layer.

reduced version of the PDF. It displays properly with AR, PDF.js and GS. With PDFBox, it displays "0./3" instead of "2015". Maybe the warnings are relevant:

org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType0Font toUnicode
WARNUNG: No Unicode mapping for CID+19 (50) in font FZLTHK_SBJT--GBK1-0
org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType0Font toUnicode
WARNUNG: No Unicode mapping for CID+17 (48) in font FZLTHK_SBJT--GBK1-0
org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType0Font toUnicode
WARNUNG: No Unicode mapping for CID+18 (49) in font FZLTHK_SBJT--GBK1-0
org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType0Font toUnicode
WARNUNG: No Unicode mapping for CID+22 (53) in font FZLTHK_SBJT--GBK1-0

Unicode mappings probably don't matter here, given that we're just drawing glyphs. Though there are cases where we do fallback to using the mapping to find glyphs, however, that would result in .notdef if there's no mapping and what we're seeing is the wrong glyph, not no glyph, so it doesn't really fit.

Also it all works fine on the Mac, so it has to be something in the TTF, not in PDF handling code.

Tims rackspace sponsored server brings the same (wrong) image.

Linux version 3.10.0-123.20.1.el7.x86_64 (mockbuild@x86-025.build.eng.bos.redhat.com) (gcc version 4.8.2 20140120 (Red Hat 4.8.2-16) (GCC) ) #1 SMP Wed Jan 21 09:45:55 EST 2015

the fallback message is different:

WARNING: Using fallback font SimSun-ExtB for CID-keyed TrueType font FZLTHK_SBJT--GBK1-0
Hmm, "SimSun-ExtB" sounds like a good substitute.

On the Mac I get this, which works:

WARNING: Using fallback font AdobeFangsongStd-Regular for CID-keyed TrueType font FZLTHK_SBJT--GBK1-0

Note that AdobeFangsongStd-Regular is an OTF CIDFont while SimSun-ExtB is a TTF font. The difference probably has something to do with substituting a PDCIDFontType 2 with a TTF.

Ok, I have the problem with "SimSun-ExtB" mostly figured out, it's related to how we implemented the more complex cases of toUnicode for CIDFonts. Fix coming soon.

I've isolated the problem with "ArialUnicodeMS" to fontbox's cmap table parsing (as suspected). CmapSubtable#processSubtype4() is parsing only 96 code -> glyph entries, however there are 38917 in the font.

Commit 1712879 from jahewson in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1712879 ]

PDFBOX-2950: follow PDF spec rules for glyph mapping via CMap -> cmap
This fixes the problem when using "SimSun-ExtB". We weren't implementing the PDF spec glyph mapping rules correctly.
The problem with "ArialUnicodeMS" hasn't been fixed, as that's due to CmapSubtable#processSubtype4(). I'm going to open a new issue for that.

Commit 1712883 from jahewson in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1712883 ]

PDFBOX-2950: clean up
PDFBOX-3092 is the follow-up issue for "ArialUnicodeMS".

The last change breaks the rendering of page 32 of https://people.apache.org/~lehmi/apachecon/ApacheConPDFBox.pdf :

java.io.IOException: Error: Could not find referenced cmap stream Adobe-Identity-UCS2
    org.apache.fontbox.cmap.CMapParser.getExternalCMap(CMapParser.java:413)
    org.apache.fontbox.cmap.CMapParser.parsePredefined(CMapParser.java:85)
    org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.CMapManager.getPredefinedCMap(CMapManager.java:54)
    org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType0Font.fetchCMapUCS2(PDType0Font.java:250)
    org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDType0Font.<init>(PDType0Font.java:127)
    org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDFontFactory.createFont(PDFontFactory.java:83)
    org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.PDResources.getFont(PDResources.java:123)
    org.apache.pdfbox.contentstream.operator.text.SetFontAndSize.process(SetFontAndSize.java:60)
    org.apache.pdfbox.contentstream.PDFStreamEngine.processOperator(PDFStreamEngine.java:821)
    org.apache.pdfbox.contentstream.PDFStreamEngine.processStreamOperators(PDFStreamEngine.java:478)
    org.apache.pdfbox.contentstream.PDFStreamEngine.processStream(PDFStreamEngine.java:452)
    org.apache.pdfbox.contentstream.PDFStreamEngine.processPage(PDFStreamEngine.java:156)
    org.apache.pdfbox.rendering.PageDrawer.drawPage(PageDrawer.java:179)
    org.apache.pdfbox.rendering.PDFRenderer.renderPage(PDFRenderer.java:208)
    org.apache.pdfbox.rendering.PDFRenderer.renderImage(PDFRenderer.java:139)
    org.apache.pdfbox.rendering.PDFRenderer.renderImage(PDFRenderer.java:68)
    org.apache.pdfbox.debugger.pagepane.PagePane$RenderWorker.doInBackground(PagePane.java:155)
    org.apache.pdfbox.debugger.pagepane.PagePane$RenderWorker.doInBackground(PagePane.java:138)
    java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

Other files with error:
PDFBOX-2294-TaroUTR50SortedList112.pdf
PDFBOX-2309-PDFBOX-147.pdf
PDFBOX-2348.pdf
PDFBOX-2711.pdf
pdfa1b.pdf from the Bavaria tests (which is why the build tests fails)

bad rendering:
PDFBOX-2599.pdf (all glyphs gone)

We've hit upon some rather vague portions of the PDF spec here, including "The means by which this is accomplished are implementation-dependent." I'm going to try a combination of the prior and new approaches, YMMV.

Commit 1713005 from jahewson in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1713005 ]

PDFBOX-2950: handle ROS cmap lookup differently

Commit 1713006 from jahewson in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1713006 ]

PDFBOX-2950: Allow CID to be used as GID when there are no other alternatives
I'm going to leave this issue open until Tilman has had a chance to test out the new changes.

looking at the PDF 2.0 (Draft 2) spec it's no longer a Note and stands out so

Type 0 fonts whose descendant CIDFonts use the Adobe-GB1, Adobe-CNS1, Adobe-Japan1, or Adobe-Korea1 character collection (as specified in the CIDSystemInfo dictionary) shall have a supplement number corresponding to the version ...

applies generally (if the spec is stable here)

That's a different passage, I'm looking at the bullet point above it before a)..e). What happens when the Encoding is Identity-H but the dependent font specifies and Adobe-GB1, etc, character collection (via CIDSystemInfo)? It doesn't seem to say...

If the font is a composite font that uses one of the predefined CMaps listed in "Table 116: Predefined CJK CMap names (except Identity–H and Identity–V) or whose descendant CIDFont uses the Adobe-GB1, Adobe-CNS1, Adobe-Japan1, or Adobe-Korea1 character collection

so if the descendant CIDFont uses Adobe-GB1 a)..e) do apply
Now it all works!
That would seem to be the interpretation which works. It does mean that the Encoding always gets overridden for Adobe-GB1, Adobe-CNS1, Adobe-Japan1, or Adobe-Korea1 fonts.
Happy days
